settings.content: GoSun builds solar appliances to help you live with more independence and resilience. Using only the Sun, now you can cook (day or night), cool, charge, light or purify water.

settings.testimonial: The Fusion, by far, is the best product I’ve purchased this year. I cooked a hearty stew of mixed vegetables and diced chicken. Needless to say, I was amazed at how well it worked.

settings.testimonial: I liked my first Chill so much, I got a second one to use as a freezer. This gives me great peace of mind in the event of an extended power outage.

settings.testimonial: My favorite thing about these panels is that you can hang them from anywhere. They reliably charged my phone & camera all week under cloudy weather. Looks super cool on the outside of our tent too :)

settings.title: Innovation
settings.subtitle: Be the first to know what features are in development and what products we're working on.

settings.content:
GoSun lives and breaths sustainability. That’s why we have created several devices that are powered exclusively by solar energy. But our mission is not only about reducing carbon output (although that is a big part of our mission). GoSun has plans to continually roll out new solar technologies in the coming years to join what we think will be this decade’s biggest revolution in innovation. All signs point toward solar dominating every form of energy—and many forms of technology—sooner than we think possible. 

This goes way beyond solar cookers or solar coolers. We are talking about solar becoming the dominant form of energy on Planet Earth in the 21st century.

Don't take our word for it. Futurist Ray Kurzweil said that solar energy will jump from covering 2% of global energy to the number one form of energy production within ten years. Kurzweil explained in 2016 that while solar is still in its infancy, it has doubled in market share every two years, jumping from 0.5% in 2012 to 2% in four yers. With these sorts of exponential growth curves, he said solar will be a major energy contendor in an amazingly short amount of time:

Some people dismissed [0.5%], saying, ‘It’s a nice thing to do, but at a half percent, it’s a fringe player… [But] half a percent is only eight doublings away from 100%. Now it is four years later, [and solar] has doubled twice again...it is only six doublings or [12] years from 100%.”

This goal isn’t some science fiction scenario in which every square inch of the earth must be blanketed with solar panels. There is plenty of sunlight for humanity to reach this number of doublings without taking up too much real estate: Even if the earth were meeting 100% of its energy needs from the sun, we would only be using 1/10,000th of the sunlight that we have. 

That's why GoSun is cooking up plans to produce all sorts of futuristic solar technologies. We are near the hockey-stick inflection point with solar technology and want to be there when the upward spike happens. 

Here are some of the technologies we plan to roll out in the future:

settings.title: Living off-grid has never been easier.
settings.description: Meet the GoSun Dream: A solar powered, off-grid, smart tiny home.

settings.filter_tags: Solar Ovens, Solar Coolers, Solar Lighting, Solar Power

settings.title: Our Story
settings.content: GoSun is a young company comprised of designers, engineers, and change-makers, intent on serving the world with unparalleled green cooking solutions. We are passionate about our products and how they power our customers’ lives. Founded in a small suburban garage, we grew quickly thanks to our community of committed customers, who not only believe in our products, but also use them to bring people together.

settings.title: A Humble Start
settings.content:
After a long morning disassembling a solar water heating device, GoSun founder and solar energy expert, Patrick Sherwin, realized that the vacuum tubes sitting next to him might be able to reheat his lunch. When the food came out hot and roasted, it was an epiphany. Having lived extensively off the grid and working on solar energy projects around the world, he knew that he was on to something.

While volunteering with non-profits in Haiti and Latin America, Patrick experienced first-hand the vulnerability of energy poverty. Touched by the resilience and happiness of those living on just $2.00/day, he spent years facilitating technology, energy and social innovations in the developing world. These efforts, including many failures to introduce typical solar ovens, led to the realization that his solar hot dog cooker invention could be something more, serving a great need in emerging markets.

For the full story, listen to this interview with Patrick on the Inside the Adventure podcast. To see his latest adventure living off only solar cooked food for 40 days take a look at the 40 Days Of Sunshine Blog.

settings.title: An Exciting Future
settings.content:
Although GoSun is still a small entrepreneurial business, we believe we should all do what we can, when we can.  

Since our inception, we have worked with dozens of nonprofit organizations to provide discounted solar cookers to those that need them most.  

In 2017, GoSun has provided funding to support the efforts of The Houston Food Bank, Global Giving, and Operation BBQ Relief. In 2018, we made donations to The American Red Cross and World Central Kitchen to assist in Hurricane Florence relief efforts.And we made a donation to the California Community Wildfire Relief Fund to aid in the the camp fire relief efforts.

 Please get in touch with us and let us know your ideas and projects.
